intro: Dalechampia herzogiana, commonly known as the Herzog's dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which is characterized by its unique floral structures and milky sap. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family, and are surrounded by modified leaves called bracts.
